citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee stated that an attending veterinarian had not visited the facility since October 2023.
Regular visits to the premises by the attending veterinarian ensure the animals are not in danger of any facility or
environmental obstacles that may cause harm to the animal. It also ensures good relations and communication with the
attending veterinarian about the welfare of the animals.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements that shall include a written
program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor. Correct by December
11, 2025.

The licensee did not have any disposition records for the death of three animals.
Good record keeping is necessary to track the health and well-being of individual animals in case of disease outbreak,
illness, planning of veterinary care, daily observations, and transfer of ownership.
Each exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning
each animal purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her
control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. Correct from this
day, November 20, 2025, forward.

On 5/19/25 a female Bobwhite quail escaped its’ primary enclosure when a door was left open by an employee. The bird
was not recovered. On 9/25/25 a female Bobwhite quail was found in the enclosure of an opossum. These two enclosures
are separated by one door that was left open by an employee. The bird was captured and was returned to its’ primary
enclosure but was found dead the next day.
Improperly trained employees can lead to animal escape and possible harm to the health and well-being of the animals.
Adequately trained employees must be utilized to maintain the professionally acceptable level of husbandry and handling
practices. Retraining was conducted after each incident. Correct from this day, November 20, 2025, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee stated that an attending veterinarian had not visited the facility since October 2023. 
 
Regular visits to the premises by the attending veterinarian ensure the animals are not in danger of any facility or 
environmental obstacles that may cause harm to the animal. It also ensures good relations and communication with the 
attending veterinarian about the welfare of the animals. 
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements that shall include a written 
program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor. Correct by December 
11, 2025. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee did not have any disposition records for the death of three animals. 
 
Good record keeping is necessary to track the health and well-being of individual animals in case of disease outbreak, 
illness, planning of veterinary care, daily observations, and transfer of ownership. 
 
Each exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning 
each animal purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her 
control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. Correct from this 
day, November 20, 2025, forward. 
3.159  Critical
   
Employees 
On 5/19/25 a female Bobwhite quail escaped its’ primary enclosure when a door was left open by an employee. The bird 
was not recovered. On 9/25/25 a female Bobwhite quail was found in the enclosure of an opossum. These two enclosures 
are separated by one door that was left open by an employee. The bird was captured and was returned to its’ primary

enclosure but was found dead the next day.  
 
Improperly trained employees can lead to animal escape and possible harm to the health and well-being of the animals. 
 
Adequately trained employees must be utilized to maintain the professionally acceptable level of husbandry and handling 
practices. Retraining was conducted after each incident. Correct from this day, November 20, 2025, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
